means.verb: If you achieve a particular aim or effect, you succeed in doing it or causing it to happen, usually after a lot of effort.

examples: We have achieved what we set out to do.

means.verb: When you approach something, you get closer to it.
means.noun: An approach to a place is a road, path, or other route that leads to it.

examples: When I approached, they grew silent.
The path serves as an approach to the boat house.

means.noun: A chain consists of metal rings connected together in a line

examples: Lock the door and put chains on?

means.verb: perform (an action, the precise nature of which is often unspecified)

examples: just do it
What exactly is it that you do ?

means.noun: A date is a specific time that can be named, for example a particular day or a particular year.

examples: What's the date today?

extend.update: If you update something, you make it more modern, usually by adding new parts to it or giving new information.

means.noun: The effect of one thing on another is the change that the first thing causes in the second thing.
means.verb: If you effect something that you are trying to achieve, you succeed in causing it to happen.

examples: Parents worry about the effect of music on their adolescent's behavior.
Not that they are taking real effect one way or another.

means.verb: When people elect someone, they choose that person to represent them, by voting for them.

examples: The people of the America have voted to elect a new president.

extend.elite: someone who is elected can be consider as elite.
extend.select: if you elect to something/somebody, sometimes means you want to select it.

means.noun: You can refer to the most powerful, rich, or talented people within a particular group, place, or society as the elite.

examples: We have a political elite in this country.

means.adverb: Maybe you use just to emphasize a right time, a right person, a right place, or a right action. or you want to emphasize only part amount.

examples: I arrived here just a moment ago.
She is the just one that i want.
This is just a part of it.

extend.adjust: do something for attach to a right situation.

means.noun: baby created by mother, everything created by necessary material.

examples: For building a house, you need many materials, such as stone, wood, sand.

means.verb: If you select something, you choose it from a number of things of the same kind.

examples: Voters are selecting candidates for both U.S. Senate seats and for 52 congressional seats.

means.verb: If you pick a particular person or thing, you choose that one.

examples: I had deliberately picked a city with a tropical climate.

extend.impeccable: If you describe something such as someone's behaviour or appearance as impeccable, you are emphasizing that it is perfect and has no faults.

means.noun: A road is a long piece of hard ground which is built between two places so that people can drive or ride easily from one place to the other.

examples: There was very little traffic on the roads.

means.verb: If you secure a place, you make it safe from harm or attack.
means.adjective: A secure place is tightly locked or well protected, so that people cannot enter it or leave it.

examples: The first priority must be to secure the future of our forests.
The moon warms emotions and helps both partners feel secure about the relationship.

means.noun: Security refers to all the measures that are taken to protect a place, or to ensure that only people with permission enter it or leave it.

examples: Strict security measures are in force in the capital.

extend.securities: stocks, shares, bonds, or other certificates that you buy in order to earn regular interest from them or to sell them later for a profit.

means.noun: a stick is a long thin piece of wood
means.verb: put the wood into somebody or something

examples: He looks old and walks with a stick.
Just a pointed building sticking out of the sand.

extend.sting: a plant, animal, or insect put a stick-like into your body
extend.stimulate: stick someone for the purpose of encourage him to do something.

means.noun: A stack of things is a pile of them.
means.verb: If you stack a number of things, you arrange them in neat piles.

examples: There were stacks of books on the bedside table and floor.
They are stacked neatly in piles of three.

means.noun: A heap of things is a pile of them, especially a pile arranged in a rather untidy way.
means.verb: If you heap things somewhere, you arrange them in a large pile.

examples: a heap of bricks
Mrs. Madrigal heaped more carrots onto Michael's plate.

means.noun: A brand of a product is the version of it that is made by one particular manufacturer.
means.verb: If someone is branded as something bad, people think they are that thing.

examples: I bought one of the leading brands.
He was instantly branded as a rebel.

means.verb: opposite to open or start. if you close something, you put it covered or finished.
means.noun: The close of a period of time or an activity is the end of it. To bring or draw something to a close means to end it.

examples: Keep the curtains closed.
By the close of business, they knew the campaign was a success

extend.disclose: If you disclose new or secret information, you tell people about it.

means.verb: when you purchase something, you buy it.
means.noun: a purchase is something that you buy.

examples: He purchased a ticket and went up on the top deck.
She opened the tie box and looked at her purchase. It was silk, with maroon stripes.

extend.chase: If you chase someone, or chase after them, you run after them or follow them quickly in order to catch or reach them.

means.verb: You can say that people are posing when you think that they are behaving in an insincere or exaggerated way because they want to make a particular impression on other people.
means.noun: A pose is a particular way that you stand, sit, or lie, for example when you are being photographed or painted.

examples: He criticized them for dressing outrageously and posing pretentiously.
In many writers modesty is a pose, but in Ford it seems to have been genuine.

extend.expose: An expos√© is a film or piece of writing which reveals the truth about a situation or person, especially something involving shocking facts.

means.adjective: Something that is high extends a long way from the bottom to the top when it is upright. You do not use high to describe people, animals, or plants.

examples: The gate was too high for them to climb.

means.noun: Light is the brightness that lets you see things. Light comes from sources such as the sun, moon, lamps, and fire.

examples: It was difficult to see in the dim light.

means.verb: If someone or something highlights a point or problem, they emphasize it or make you think about it.

examples: Once again, the 'Free Press' prefers not to highlight these facts.

means.verb: If you serve your country, an organization, or a person, you do useful work for them.

examples: There must be someone else who could serve you that way

extend.server: someone who can support serve. such as Internet Server.
extend.servant: A servant is someone who is employed to work at another person's home, for example as a cleaner or a gardener.

means.verb: If you observe a person or thing, you watch them carefully, especially in order to learn something about them.

examples: John still studies and observes the behaviour of babies.

extend.observer: You can refer to someone who sees or notices something as an observer.

means.noun: A type of something is a group of those things that have particular features in common.

examples: There are various types of the apple.

means.noun: If you say that someone or something is a prototype of a type of person or thing, you mean that they are the first or most typical one of that type.

examples: He was the prototype of the elder statesman.
